required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interstitial Brachytherapy Boost for Treatment of Anal Canal Cancers, Comparison of Two Dose Rates
clinical_study.official_title: Interstitial Brachytherapy Boost for Treatment of Anal Canal Cancers, Comparison of Two Dose Rates

brief_summary.textblock: Comparative retrospective study of two anal canal brachytherapy techniques aimed at boosting [low dose rate (LDR) and high dose rate (HDR)]

detailed_description.textblock: Efficacy of anal canal interstitial brachytherapy evaluated by local relapse rate, Tolerance of interstitial brachytherapy of the anal canal evaluated by the rate of chronic toxicities.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the efficacy of interstitial brachytherapy of the anal canal
primary_outcome.description: Efficacy of anal canal interstitial brachytherapy evaluated by local relapse rate

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the tolerance of interstitial brachytherapy of the anal canal
primary_outcome.description: Tolerance of interstitial brachytherapy of the anal canal evaluated by the rate of chronic toxicities.

secondary_outcome.description: Local control defined as the time between the date of diagnosis and the date of local relapse or death or recent news
Disease free survival defined as the delay between the date of diagnosis and the date of local or locoregional or distant relapse or death or recent news
Overall survival defined as the time between the date of diagnosis and the date of death or latest news

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the incidence of toxicities (CTCAE v4) between the 2 groups

arm_group.description: Patients treated with brachytherapy at low dose rate of the anal canal with aim of boost
Patients treated by brachytherapy with a high dose rate of the anal canal aiming for boost

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated with anal canal brachytherapy for boost, between 2008 and 2016.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients treated by brachytherapy anal canal to boost.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients below age of 18 years

results_reference.citation: Cordoba A, Escande A, Leroy T, Mirabel X, Coche-Dequ√©ant B, Lartigau E. Low-dose-rate interstitial brachytherapy boost for the treatment of anal canal cancers. Brachytherapy. 2017 Jan - Feb;16(1):230-235. doi: 10.1016/j.brachy.2016.07.007. Epub 2016 Sep 3.

Boukhelif W, Ferri-Molina M, Mazeron R, Maroun P, Duhamel-Oberlander AS, Dumas I, Martinetti F, Guemnie-Tafo A, Chargari C, Haie-Meder C. Interstitial pulsed-dose-rate brachytherapy for the treatment of squamous cell anal carcinoma: A retrospective single institution analysis. Brachytherapy. 2015 Jul-Aug;14(4):549-53. doi: 10.1016/j.brachy.2015.03.006. Epub 2015 Apr 29.
